alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Northampton; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 10:08AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Camden, southeastern Pasquotank, Currituck, and southern Northampton Counties, the southeastern City of Norfolk, the southeastern City of Chesapeake and the City of Virginia Beach through 1045 AM EDT... At 1008 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Norfolk International to 6 miles northeast of Princess Anne to Weeksville. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Virginia Beach and Norfolk around 1015 AM EDT. Currituck around 1040 AM EDT. Knotts Island and Corolla around 1045 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Bob White Fork, Rudee Heights, Princess Anne Plaza, Sigma, Gregory, Pungo, Barco, Bayside, Kiptopeke and Spences Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Northampton; Virginia Beach
